Detailed Description

The CMutex class wraps a native FreeRTOS mutex handle (xSemaphoreHandle). To create a mutex instance an object of this class and then call its CMutex::Create method like showed in the following sample: 

 CMutex g_aMutex // global mutex declaration.

 void taskControlFunc(void *pParams) // a task control loop
 {
       g_aMutex.Create();

       for (;;) {
              while (g_aMutex.Take(portMAX_DELAY) != pdTRUE) {
              // do something
              }
 }
See also:
mutex documentation in the FreeRTOS web site.
Date:
Jul 14, 2010

Definition at line 37 of file CMutex.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CMutex::CMutex ( )

Default constructor. It initializes the object without attaching it to a native FreeRTOS handle. Call the Create method to allocate a mutex handle and attach it to the object.

CMutex::CMutex ( xSemaphoreHandle  handleSemaphore)

Create a mutex instance and attach it to a valid handle.

handleSemaphorea valid mutex handle.

CMutex::~CMutex ( ) [virtual]

Destructor. It deletes the native FreeRTOS recursive mutex.

Member Function Documentation

bool CMutex::Create ( )

Create a FreeRTOS mutex and attach its handle to the receiver object.

See also:
xSemaphoreCreateMutex FreeRTOS API function.
Returns:
true if the mutex is created with success, false otherwise.
